reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as a free night stop over on the way to Europe. The stopover was paid for by Singapore Airlines and was rated in the middle of the range hotels that we considered, albeit that you really dont get much choice on a free stop over hotel.
reviews.title: Just OK, You definitely get what you pay for but its Ok for the price.

reviews.text: The hotel was not somewhere we would have booked had we been paying for it but it did the job as a base for a one night wirlwind stopover in Singapore with friends who had never been to Singapore before.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The hotel is old and very tired, which is obvois from the minute you pull up.
reviews.title: a hotel in the middle of everywhere...

reviews.text: The lobby looks good on the internet but it was probably a stock photo from 20 years ago as the lobby is also very tired and dated compared to other Singapore hotels we have stayed in.
reviews.title: Great overall-you get what you pay for

reviews.text: The worst first impression of this place is the staff who gree you and check you in. I have never experienced such unattentive and gruff Sigapreans before. they really let the place down the most. The staff seem like there are always bickering with each other and all look far too stressed for a small hotel.
reviews.title: Good for a stopover

reviews.text: Booked this hotel via the hotel website as they proposed a special deal with free internet and late checkout. Had to ask for the promised late check out twice before they granted it. The room was all in all ok although the bathroom was a bit dirty. The gym is a tiny room with a bycicle but the pool is of average size. The included breakfast was good for Asian standards. Would possibly stay here again if they offer inclusive deals via their homepage.
reviews.title: Nothing thrilling but standard hotel in Singapore

reviews.text: Perfect location to all the scenic sites (perfect for photographers) and malls. Rooms are clean and tidy with free high speed internet! Exit the hotel and you will find that you are surrounded by food courts!
reviews.title: Right in the middle of Everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my partner mid-May on a stop-over to Europe. Considering it was included in our ticket price, we were very happy. It was close to a metro station and Orchard Rd and was comfortable. Not fabulous but not bad considering.
reviews.title: Good place for a stopover

reviews.text: Its a good hotel family hotel, very friendly staff, good food, peaceful location, centrally located, well connected.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For Indian vegetarians there is not much choice, try to get hotel nr. Little India.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel !

reviews.text: The only good thing about this hotel is the location, but there are plenty of others nearby.
reviews.title: Hopeless

reviews.text: I didn't accept the first two rooms I was given as both had ants crawling all over and the first had very noisy A/C. The third was just about acceptable, but way below expectations for the price. All had connecting doors, which I was assured were well noise insulated, but on my second night I was disturbed continually by next door residents (only talking!).
reviews.title: good breakfast buffet

reviews.text: Room amenities (shampoo etc) were clearly the cheapest they could buy and the shower curtain had been badly located so that it made the space to shower about 300mm wide - so it kept sticking to me throughout.
reviews.title: Hotel Royal at Queens - we would consider it again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No free water bottles were provided, so it was either buy from the mini-bar or go out to a shop - unforgivable in a humid climate.
reviews.title: Terrible Experience. Avoid

reviews.text: Internet was not cheap and frankly was unusable - it took me 10 mins+ to check in online! At least they credited this on my bill.
reviews.title: well situated
Ok
reviews.text: Good location, budget hotel and very expensive for what you get. Room quite large however because you cannot turn air conditioning off - very noisy at night. Kept me awake for most of the night. Breakfast ok, only stay here if you get a good price

Great for a nights stay over, close to Bras Bah MRT station and local shops. Staff are very effecient with there check in check out process. We stayed with our two boy's who enjoyed the pool and the buffet breakfast. We took the MRT to the airport on leaving and it was a easy trip from this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Stay Convinent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Queens for three nights. The hotels is a 25 min drive from the airport. Location of the hotel is such that everything from shopping plazas to nightlife seems close to the hotel. The MRT station brash brash is 1 min away from the hotel. Getting a cab from the hotel is also very convenient. Singapore hotels near the Royal are at least 20 per cent more expensive. Rooms are clean and decently spacious. Staff is courteous and polite. It has a very tiny pool and gym. Always opt for a room with breakfast in Singapore. The Royal offers room with breakfast at reasonable rates.Overall value for money. Would recommend to travellers who are on a moderate budget. The hotel lets you check in early subject to availability of room.
reviews.title: Nice hotel at great location. Value for Money

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights with a Singapore Stopover with our 15 month old son and mother in law (she was in her own room).
reviews.title: A good stay

reviews.text: After reading some previous reviews we were a bit concerned as to what the hotel would be like. We were pleasantly surprised - the check in staff were great and really helpful, the room was ready and was a good size. Very clean and not too used and abused. I did have a minor issue with the shower curtain which tended to be sucked into the shower and would stick to the body - not too cool when your trying to hold and shower your baby at the same time.
reviews.title: Cheap for Singapore, great location.
